name: Yicheng's Homepage
body:
Yicheng Zhang, Ph.D. Candidate, [Google Scholar](https://scholar.google.com.sg/citations?user=cdUWyuAAAAAJ&hl=en/)

School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore

yzhang088@e.ntu.edu.sg

### Short Bio
Mr. Yicheng Zhang is a PhD candidate under the supervision of Prof Su Rong in School of Electrical and Electronic Engineering, Nanyang Technological University (NTU). He is affiliated with Rolls-Royce @ NTU Corporate Lab. 
Mr. Zhang received his Master degree from Division of Automation, School of Information Science and Technology, University of Science and Technology of China (USTC) in 2014, and his Bachelor degree from School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Hefei University of Technology (HFUT) in 2011. Since August 2014, he became a PhD candidate in Nanyang Technological University. His current research interests include optimization method, power scheduling and intelligent transportation systems. 



### Research Interests

* Optimization method
  * Distributed optimization
  * Lagrangian relaxation
* Smart Grid
  * Power allocation and scheduling in smart grid
  * Optimal power flow
  * Optimal control design in smart grid
* Intelligent transportation systems
  * Traffic system modelling
  * Traffic flow management


### Current Research

* (Apr 2015 - now) Distributed Model Predictive Routing and Scheduling for Minimizing Network-wise En-Route and Airport Arrival Delay in Air Traffic Flow Management with an Eulerian-Lagrangian Flow Dynamic Model
* (Apr 2015 - now) Distributed Adaptive Urban Traffic Signal Control based on V2X Information Infrastructure
* (Aug 2014 - now) Intelligent Power Allocation and Scheduling for More Electrical Aircraft
  * This project is under Rolls Royce @ NTU Corp Lab. The main objective is to develop an intelligent power management system that is scalable and flexible to be applied to systems with different levels of complexity.
